snippet: The authorities in Paris are trying to make sure that none of the paintings and other art by Alain Le Yaouanc are lost or damaged as eviction looms.
abstract: Artist Alain Le Yaouanc was once hailed as one of France's greatest artistic geniuses, but in recent years his work stopped selling; after financial setbacks, he is now being evicted from his Paris studio of nearly 50 years, and many are worried that eviction will endanger his works, a rich part of France’s 20th-century cultural legacy; authorities are trying to ensure that none of his paintings are lost or damaged.
lead_paragraph: The authorities in Paris are trying to make sure that none of the paintings and other art by Alain Le Yaouanc are lost or damaged as eviction looms.

headline.main: As Debts Pile Up, an Artist and His Work Face Eviction in Paris
headline.print_headline: As Debts Pile Up, an Artist and His Work Face Eviction in Paris
